```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(modeldb)
library(emmeans)

set.seed(74)
dat <- tibble(
  a = rep(0:1, each=150),
  b = as.factor(rep(rep(0:2, each=1), 100)))

dat <- dat %>% 
  add_dummy_variables(b, values = c(0,1,2), remove_original = F)

y = 2 + rnorm(300,.7,.5)*dat$a + rnorm(300,.9,.5)*dat$b_1 +  rnorm(300,-.8,.5)*dat$b_2 + rnorm(300,.1,.5)*dat$a*dat$b_1 + rnorm(300,.19,.5)*dat$a*dat$b_2 + rnorm(300,0,.5)

dat <- dat %>% 
add_column(y)


test <- lm(y ~ a + b_1 + b_2 + a*b_1 + a*b_2, data=dat)
test2 <- lm(y ~ a*b, dat)
summary(test2)


```


1. Run a factorial anova using brms. Interpret the summary output. 

2. Graph 
  a. The two simple main effects (assume no interactions)
  b. A figure to demonstrate the interactions
  c. The differences/contrasts between the main effects 
  d. The differences/contrasts between each cell 
  e. A prediction interval (95%?) for each cell
